description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). Physical description: Number of lines per page varies. Written in small to medium small naskh in black ink with ample use of red. European paper with watermark, glossy. Table of contents on fol. Aa-b. Inscription stating the number of leaves in the copy on fol. 431b. Illustrations: Tables, charts, diagrams, and illustrations. See in particular the hand on fol. 125a and the comets on fol. 311a. Origin: Several texts are dated (see fol. 73b, 164a, 171b, 180a, 205b, 227b, fol. 256b), ranging from 19 Jumādá al-Ulá 1060 (fol. 269a) to 20 Shawwāl 1061 (fol. 73b). The place of copy is mentioned in one colophon as being Qusṭanṭinīyah (Constantinople) ( fol. 164a). The name of the copyist, Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá, is mentioned on fol. 171b and 227b. Inscription in red pencil in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover and on a label pasted on the pastedown of the same cover: "SH 158".
abstract: Collection of treatises in Arabic, Persian, and Ottoman Turkish, on geometry, astronomy, astronomical instruments, mathematics, and divination, with illustrations, tables and figures.
alternative: Majmūʻat al-rasāʾil al-nādirah fī ʻulūm al-falakīyah
